title: I gotta say 5.5 is probably one of my favorite balance patches in a while.
body:
Is it perfect? No. But I'm smiling a lot more than frowning, and it seems to be a hell of a lot better than 'Let's Trashcan Veigar and Kass' 5.4. 

-Bard's coming out.

-Cinderhulk will let a lot of tanky junglers breathe easier. 

-Jungle's getting a TAD bit easier. 

-Luden's Echo can start making its way into builds.

-Nidalee nerfs! 

I just hope 5.6 continues this pattern.

> [{quoted}](name=Splininka,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RrMkAERu,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2015-03-11T23:49:57.855+0000)

Now it has a .5 second delay that starts at the same time as the animation, meaning that it appears at the same time as the old instant version.
> 
> If I'm misinformed, on how old Veigar worked, please correct me. I used to play him a bunch, but relied on "feel" rather than knowing exactly how it was hooked up.

I actually think you're significantly mistaken on this point, unless I myself have seriously misunderstood what's happened.

# Old Veigar Stun
Total time from button press to cage appearance: 0.25s

* .25s cast delay
* No "HEY VEIGAR IS ABOUT TO STUN YOU!" warning animation

The old Veigar stun could hit a target with the edge, if you lined it up so that the edge landed on top of them and they didn't move too much during the relatively short time between pushing E and the cage's appearance. This allowed Veigar to stun a target, preventing them from killing him and often allowing him to kill them instead.

If Veigar failed to land the stun on the edge, of course, nothing prevented the enemy from killing him from inside the cage. Missed stuns tended to very quickly result in gray screens.

# 5.4 Veigar Stun
Total time from button press to cage appearance: 1.00s

* .25s cast delay
* .75s "HEY VEIGAR IS ABOUT TO STUN YOU!" warning animation (following .25s cast delay)

This was a massive change. Before, the cage appeared after the .25s cast delay, stunning anyone standing within the ring surrounding the cage. After this change, the .25s cast delay was followed by a large warning animation that lasted for .75s and showed where the cage would appear, providing an amount of time equivalent to the delay on Cho's Rupture ("UP you go!") to step away from the cage. Bear in mind that, unlike Rupture, Event Horizon is not a filled circle but a hollow ring: it only stuns people with the walls. If you're either outside the cage or inside the cage, the ability cannot stun you.

This change was a huge nerf to Veigar, because it changed his Event Horizon from a stun (albeit one with an awkward hitbox) into at best a zoning ability that could force an enemy to stay inside a fairly spacious cage.

They did give it a little extra range; I think 50 units, or half a Teemo.

# 5.5 Veigar Stun
Total time from button press to cage appearance: 0.75s

* .75s "HEY VEIGAR IS ABOUT TO STUN YOU!" warning animation 
* No separate cast delay (though presumably there's still a .25s window during which you can kill or stun Veigar to prevent his cage from appearing at all).
* Stops dashes

The dash-stopping is nice; before, people could Caitlyn net or whatever throw the wall, landing on the other side (right in Veigar's face) stunned but close enough to promptly kill him after recovering.

However, the primary nerf is still there: there is still a Rupture-length delay during which all an enemy need do is walk a few steps in any direction to avoid being stunned. If the edge isn't placed on top of them, it's even easier: they have a full .75s to **not walk into the slowly appearing walls.**

Why does this matter? Well, it means that Veigar's Event Horizon at best can force an enemy to stand in the cage and fight him. That's not really a great scenario for Veigar. Actually, that's usually the scenario that Veigar is trying to escape.

>it means that Veigar's Event Horizon at best can force an enemy to stand in the cage and fight him. That's not really a great scenario for Veigar. Actually, that's usually the scenario that Veigar is trying to escape.

To be fair, Veigar putting the enemy team in that situation isn't so bad considering what an opening that is for his initiator, and that his Q can hit 2 enemies.

He can drop rocks off of the tank or fighter's CC. And they can land their CC off of his cage. In a straight duel veigar isn't as strong anymore, but he is encouraged to use his event horizon to the teams benefit rather than just stunning his chosen target.

Its a big change pattern and thematic wise, but I like it. I like that the delay and cast time have been rolled together.

Even in a teamfight situation, there's no reason for anyone to get stunned by his Event Horizon, unless his team has already stunned them. I think that's a truly fundamental flaw.

It bears mentioning that these changes were meant to be "compensation buffs" for the removal of DFG, widely considered Veigar's core item.

As for being weaker in a straight duel, I don't think that should be glossed over quite so quickly. The reasons why he's no longer any good at dueling also make it even harder for him to survive lane. Before, if he landed it just right, he could use his Event Horizon to escape from an enemy mid or gank. He could also use the threat of a full-rotation 100-0 burst to keep the enemy at bay, once he got fed enough to credibly threaten that.

When I tried new Veigar, the enemy mid let me free-farm my Q without trouble, but I have absolutely no idea why they did. I was playing in Normal queue, which might explain it. I cannot imagine a Gold mid letting Veigar free-farm after these changes.

>Even in a teamfight situation, there's no reason for anyone to get stunned by his Event Horizon, unless his team has already stunned them. I think that's a truly fundamental flaw.

I disagree. Just because they don't get stunned doesn't mean you didn't do anything. You forced movement, course changes, you got in their way. This is the original purpose of the spell. If veigar was supposed to have a skillshot stun, he could have one. He doesn't. He has a cage that stuns enemies who touch the walls. They will in fact only be stunned if they hit the wall, I don't think this is a flaw. The purpose isn't the stun; its the cage. That old veigar just used it for the stun was really a design flaw of the champion.

>It bears mentioning that these changes were meant to be "compensation buffs" for the removal of DFG, widely considered Veigar's core item.

I actually do not think it does. They had an event (DFG removal) that finally forced their hand and they had to at least change veigar. They are trying to put him in a place that allows him to be healthy for the game. Growing pains are to be expected. Especially for a champ like veigar, who was designed on old  goals and directives, this was gonna suck. I actually found the core ideas behind the changes to be brilliant though. They just shouldn't have been so conservative with their first iteration.

>The reasons why he's no longer any good at dueling also make it even harder for him to survive lane.

I again disagree. When spaced properly, yeah your enemy will avoid the stun, but a defensive E can still force the enemy to disengage, and Q still can last hit from 200 more distance than it used to be able to.
Surviving lane has always been the challenge with veigar, but he still has the tools to do it.

>He could also use the threat of a full-rotation 100-0 burst to keep the enemy at bay, once he got fed enough to credibly threaten that.

He still has that threat. He just doesn't get to do if for free just because the enemy is wtihin 1050 range. (I know it was hard to actually do this as veigar, but he was capable of it, and had to be balanced around that.

Escape horizon is still perfectly strong for ganking or escaping. It just requires a little more planning and a little less reaction time.

>When I tried new Veigar, the enemy mid let me free-farm my Q without trouble, but I have absolutely no idea why they did. I was playing in Normal queue, which might explain it. I cannot imagine a Gold mid letting Veigar free-farm after these changes.

I won't lie, he did get weaker. That said, part of why you get to farm is because if they try to put themselves between you and your minions, they eat a baleful strike, AND YOU STILL GET THE MINION! Also you likely have a new wave of minions who will happily push a low level champion back behind their minion line. Truly zoning veigar out early on has actually gotten more difficult for enemies. In exchange landing aggressive stuns is much much harder. Its still great for ganking. Veigar dropping you inside of his cage during a gank is still a death sentence. You might get to wiggle around inside it, but he and his team are still gonna kill you.

I hate to tell you this, but you clearly did not play veigar. Here are the things you are correct about.
His Q can harass and farm minions at the same time
His Old E was toxic (stupidly OP)
He is weaker

Here are things you are incorrect about.
Veigar being useful in a teamfight with his cage: people will not be stunned in his cage because there is a telegraphed warning before hand. While they cannot dash away once the cage is up, they can dash/ walk away during the warning. in order to get close enough to truly trap them, they SHOULD have the presence of mind to notice your intention.

It doesn't matter that these were supposed to be compensation for dfg removal: Veigar is a burst mage. While he did not NEED Dfg, he certainly used it well. You realize that, unless removing dfg was a straight buff for veigar, these changes were clearly in the wrong direction. 

Event horizon is still good for escaping and ganking: This is flat out false. a lot happens in .75 seconds, including your death and movement. while stopping dashes will help, most people will be on top of you or completely gone by the time your walls trigger. it is very difficult to plan a full second ahead in League of legends, not to mention that now your moves are being telegraphed and they are the ones reacting. A veigar player now cannot win, only the opponent can lose.

Zoning is harder against a veigar: Also just completely wrong. before you would have to worry about a stun followed up by lots of damage if you got too aggressive. now dont have to worry about that at all. and the minions argument you bring up is only relevant for VERY early game. Veigar's Q was mainly used for harass, not for farm. now there is no reason for an enemy to not spend their laning phase making you miserable, because you really cant punish them. a gank can help you out, but they just need to buy wards. easy. Veigar has 0 lane pressure now. His baleful strike also mow pushes the wave with hitting two minions. that is not something you want because if you are ganked, you are dead. veigar waddles very slowly and only incompetent junglers will not kill you unless you burn flash.

Catching someone inside the cage is a good thing: Back when Veigar had dfg, catching someone in the cage was a VERY bad thing. In fact, it was considered a missed stun. so that has not changed. While, yes, it can work out if your team is there, there is not one circumstance where it works out well for veigar in a 1v1. He will die 90% of the time. now, not only is it harder to stun someone, but also harder to trap them in the cage. and even harder to land your damage (W was only good for waveclear or if you landed your stun). So yet another completely false fact you have presented. 

Veigar has the tools to survive lane: Where are you getting these facts? Sadly, no veigar does not have the tools to survive lane. he is EXTREMELY passive now, which is easily punishable. He is made of wet paper, so he dies very easily. but now he cant even say for people to back off of him. he doesnt have the damage (nerfed ultimate and useless W) and he doesnt have the CC. So why would anyone not just jump on you, since your only damage now is auto attacks.

Veigar had around a 48-49% winrate pre 5.4. making him weaker is not an okay thing. champions falling below 40% winrate (30% in diamond) is not something that will be sorted out with time. It means the character is bad and needs work.
